content.headline: Pregnancy Second Trimester: Weeks 13-27
content.intro: Lasting from week 13 to week 27, the second trimester of pregnancy is often thought of as the best part of pregnancy. For many people, morning sickness and fatigue from the first trimester go away at this point.

sections.title: What is the second trimester of pregnancy?
sections.content: Your second trimester begins around week 13 of pregnancy and lasts through the end of week 27. When you're in your second trimester, you're in the middle of your pregnancy.
points: Often feels like the best trimester with fading morning sickness and fatigue
Anxiety from first trimester typically goes away
You'll start looking and feeling more pregnant
May experience a burst of energy
Start to feel the fetus move by 18 to 20 weeks

sections.title: How does my baby develop during the second trimester?
sections.content: The fetus goes through many changes during your second trimester of pregnancy:
points: Starts to look more like a child with defined facial features
Develops eyelids, eyebrows, eyelashes, nails and hair by month four
Can stretch, make faces and suck its thumb
Sex can be determined on ultrasound around 20 weeks
You'll feel movement called 'quickening' - like flutters or butterflies
Can hear you in the last few weeks of the trimester

sections.title: What happens to my body during the second trimester?
sections.content: Your body continues to change and adapt:
points: Uterus continues to expand to the size of a watermelon
You'll start gaining weight and developing a visible baby bump
Everyone shows at different times - no two bodies look the same

sections.title: Common discomforts in the second trimester
sections.content: While generally feeling better, you might experience:
points: Increased appetite
Bleeding gums and nosebleeds (due to hormones)
Hemorrhoids and nasal congestion
Skin changes like linea nigra and darkened areolas
Round ligament pain
Swelling in hands, feet and ankles
Varicose veins and stretch marks
Increased risk of UTIs and yeast infections

sections.title: Tests during the second trimester
sections.content: Your provider will order various tests:
points: Anatomy ultrasound to check fetal development
Gestational diabetes screening
Rh factor testing
Complete blood count for anemia
Rescreening of syphilis

sections.title: Preparing for birth and beyond
sections.content: Start thinking about these important topics:
points: Discuss your birth preferences (vaginal, assisted, C-section)
Take educational classes about labor, breastfeeding and parenting
Choose a pediatrician
Tour the hospital where you'll give birth

sections.title: Staying healthy in the second trimester
points: Exercise for about 20 minutes daily (walking, swimming)
Eat nutritious foods and take prenatal vitamins
Attend all prenatal appointments
Avoid contact sports and activities with fall risk

sections.title: What to avoid during the second trimester
points: Raw or undercooked meat and unpasteurized dairy
Deli meats and fish high in mercury
Hot tubs and saunas
Smoking, alcohol and recreational drugs
Cleaning litter boxes (risk of toxoplasmosis)
Sleeping on your back - sleep on your side instead

sections.title: When to call your provider
sections.content: Contact your healthcare provider right away if you experience:
points: Unusual or severe cramping or abdominal pain
Vaginal bleeding
Difficulty breathing that gets worse
Signs of premature labor:
• Regular contractions (more than 4 times per hour)
• Fluid leakage (possible water breaking)
• Any concerns about your pregnancy
